phrase.cizu_name: knock (或 take) the stuffing out of

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)severely impair the confidence or strength of (someone)
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)严重挫伤…的锐气（或元气）

entry.tran: (烹饪前塞入鸡或辣椒等食物内的)填料
entry.def: Stuffing is a mixture of food that is put inside a bird such as a chicken, or a vegetable such as a pepper, before it is cooked.

example.ex: Chestnuts can be used at Christmas time, as a stuffing for turkey, guinea fowl or chicken.
example.tran: 栗子可以在圣诞节时作火鸡、珍珠鸡或家鸡的填料。

entry.def: Stuffing is material that is used to fill things such as cushions or toys in order to make them firm or solid.

entry.tran: 挫败…的锐气;使扫兴;使一蹶不振
entry.def: If something knocks the stuffing out of you when you are feeling enthusiastic or confident about something, it causes you to lose your enthusiasm or confidence.

example.ex: Men have had a hard time for the last fifteen years. The women's movement knocked the stuffing out of them.
example.tran: 男性在过去的 15 年中一直灰头土脸。妇女运动挫败了男人的傲气。

means.word_mean: 1. a mixture of seasoned ingredients used to stuff meats and vegetables
2. padding put in mattresses and cushions and upholstered furniture
